annotation.TEXT: This one's kind of nifty.
Yay, normalcy.
Yes, now I can unlock these coins!
Yeah, that sucks. So, you do not want to get over 99, or you'll have to do it all over again. Talk about wasted effort... Well, I guess it's time for ludicrous speed!
Hahaha! Yeah, I'll be sure to tell him.
To be continued...
You can't enter the pipe, and it's not used as an exit either I don't think, nor does it house any enemies. It's just kind of... there.
Bah. I keep making obvious mistakes. Not to worry. I've almost got 15 coins.
One note block should be sufficient there.
Okay, now I'll start collecting the good stuff.
Whoa! What's this? Wow, Toad's angry at me for some reason. Also, I can use 15 coins to hurt him. Good to know.
Now remember this for later, viewers.
Is it possible to get that other double-duty coin without hitting the loser coins? ...Wait, I've got an idea.
Alright, Lakitu, let's go... for boss time!
Also, the springboard has a use over here too.
Now, as for these, I'm probably going to have to hit a couple of bad coins, but I should be able to turn a profit here too.
Sweet! Now for the room below (and I think you absolutely have to enter this level big to access this room, unless there's a power up I'm not aware of).
Okay, just one more!
So, to get some of these, I'm going to have to come back with a key.
Wait, what? No! I tried to pay you 98 coins! Dude, be reasonable!
Okay, so I've got to come up with 75 coins. Let's get started!
Toad's House, eh? Did this belong to that same anti-coin-chucking Toad?
Don't worry about any coins I miss for right now. I'll be coming back this way.
First, grab as many anti-coins as I can while I'm broke.
Okay, not bad. Now, where to next?
Let me in the dang pipe, man.
Awesome, the Red Switch! (Also, there's a side exit in case you come here again after hitting the Red Switch for whatever reason.)
Ooh, look at all of those McDoubles! But, I'm going to have to lose at least a couple coins to collect them. Still, it's a six-coin profit if I do it right!
Ah, a springboard. Also, what's that pipe for?

And that opens up the next level, which seems kind of explosive, but I'm not gonna head there yet, as I have unfinished business in Forest of Doors? What kind of unfinished business? Find out next time!
Also, try not to make Lakitu go off screen whenever you can help it. It's kind of hard for him to deliver coins to you while out-of-bounds.
Oh, hey there, Toad. How's it going?
Sounds colorful. Let's check it out!
So, in this fight, Lakitu tosses coins at you, while tons of anti-coins scroll onto the field from the top.
Yeah, Bowser sucks like that.
Alright, so I now have my 75 coins, plus change, but let's see how high I can get my total before talking to Toad. Is 100 achievable?
Secret exit!
Ooh, look at all of those normal coins. Try not to hit too many anti-coins when going for them!
Bounce up here, while avoiding the wallet-draining-coins, to collect more of the good stuff.
Ugh! Poison coin! Get it away from me!
That's two hits. Yeah, this is taking a while.
Alright, now that I've got cash in my wallet, I want to avoid those negative coins like the plague.
Also, strangely, there are some normal coins among the ones raining down. You'll probably have to hit at least one anti-coin to reach them, but it's worth it.
Red blocks for everybody!
Okay, scumbag, here's exactly 75 coins for you this time. Also, I'll keep it at ludicrous speed through the boss fight as well.
Ah, there's the key-- What?! A bridge building segment? You just did that to artificially extend the length of the level!
75 coins? That's highway robbery! But, I guess I'll pay for the convenience...
You're going to want to avoid as many of the anti-coins as possible, obviously. Man, it's almost like dodging danmaku, but hitting an anti-coin is only a minor setback and isn't fatal.

Don't get munched now! That would be bad! ...Hey, wasn't I Fire Mario when I first started this level? Yeah, but it disappeared when the boss fight started. Being small was more helpful there anyway, but there should've been a replacement power up available when I finished it.
Whenever your coin total hits 15, you can press up to spend 15 coins to damage Toad. Toad's HP is shown to the right of the reserve item. It takes four hits to defeat him.
Oops. And then I manage to make a mistake with that. Also, due to the sprite limit, Lakitu is unable to produce more than four moving coins at once, so start collecting them then.
Wow, I did that part poorly.
98 coins! Oh, so close! I wonder if I could get 100 with tool-assistance? Maybe I'll try that later.
So, last time, I had just made my way through the Forest of Doors, and have now arrived at the Colorful Coin Palace.
Ooh, a 2-for-1 deal! Me like!
Man, I'm getting sloppy.
This jump is a little tricky.
There are some gaps that are just too small to fit through without hitting an anti-coin, so don't worry about being forced to hit a few here and there.
Just like that, I've hit the quota, but can I get 25 more?
Ack. I was trying to be fancy, but it didn't work. Oh, well.
Wait, what? Aw, don't tell me he treated my coin count as zero...
Okay, that's enough of that. Now let's just enter the pipe like normal.
Oh, yeah. Can't forget these four locked coins over here, up above the pipe-that-I-don't-know-what-it's-for.
Yep, seems to be.
Oh, there's a second message. That's interesting.
Bam! Toad takes damage! Now I've just gotta do that three more times.

Now to go for the normal exit, but unfortunately, this means doing all of that coin-related stuff all over again. However, this would be a good time for me to see if 100 coins is reachable with tool-assistance!
Also, try not to accidentally crash into those two snioc like an idiot when you're going for the key.
Hey there everyone, this is Some-Guy-Seven-Twelve-Ecks!
That should say "you" behind Mario, but I bet you already know that.
Okay, it's good to know that if I screw up, I can reset the place.
Hmm... I think if I'm careful here, I might be able to avoid both of those reverse coins.
Gack! Well, I think hitting one coin of undoing was unavoidable, but I can still avoid the other two.
Aw, I need a key for these. Also, watch out for the skull coins. Actually, the evil coins have no effect at all if you collect them while your pockets are empty.
Yes! I was briefly at 102, before I fell onto those anti-coins below. Still, I achieved at least 100! Now, let's go see if this makes Toad happy!
Oh, but that's not all. There's more gold over here!
D'oh. Lakitu, try to keep your coins in-bounds!
That's the third hit. Oh, yeah... Since the anti-coins are harmless while I'm broke, I should run around collecting a bunch of them before I start collecting any more normal coins.
"Anti-coins"? Is that what those things are called? I've been calling them all sorts of other names, such as Joe.
Alright, Toad. Here's your cash, plus a 30% tip for being awesome.
Ahem... As I was saying, one note block should be sufficient here!
And now I am free to enter this pipe. But, wait! There's more to this room...

Anyway, the springboard and key are still in their usual locations, and this pipe is still just... there. Also, did you see a keyhole at the top of the screen just after I grabbed the springboard? Yep, guess where I'm heading.
Unfortunately, I have to grab at least one coin there. Still, it's not enough to discourage anti-coin-collecting yet.
Oh, man, text.
Playin' somethin' strange. Heck, yeah.
